data.message: Hey Facebook, is it truly safe to use Messenger? I had it before but all of those rumors about our privacy being invaded had me delete it. Were those rumors true or not?

replies.message: Hey Stephen. We hear your concern—many of the reports about Messenger app permissions simply aren't true. Learn more about how we actually use permissions for Messenger: http://on.fb.me/1vWBxxa . -Jenny
Hi Stephen thats like asking your drug dealer if there drugs are good or bad. im not saying the stuff is true but asking fb if they are isnt prob the best person to ask

That article is helpful.  So thank you for that.  However, I think some improvements need to be made on the app.  My phone used to last through my entire work day and then some without needing a charge.  Soon I found I could barely get through 6 hours without the battery dying.  Why?  Because Messenger was taking up almost 50% of my battery usage and draining my battery faster than anything else running on my phone.  I uninstalled it for now because I shouldn't have to keep my phone plugged in all day at work because Messenger is constantly on, running, and using battery time even when I want it (or try to) turn it off.

Thanks for your feedback, Jenn! We're constantly working to make our products better. We'll take this back to our team, and if you have any more suggestions, let us know here: http://on.fb.me/WpcTpx -Sarah
